intro: Phalacroseris bolanderi var. coronata, commonly known as the Bolander's phalacroseris, is a rare and endemic plant species native to specific regions of California. It is characterized by its unique morphology, featuring narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in coastal or inland areas with specific microclimatic conditions. Its floral structure is adapted for pollination by specific insect species, contributing to its ecological niche. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
